bug.short_desc: No implicit cache flush for clean-files job action

long_desc.thetext:
There're cases when it's necessary to fine-tune a build process. For example, in case of build job, it could be a partial build or a resource management which result in obsolete files under build directory which pile up on each change. And in many cases build directory should contain only fresh files.
Considering the manual ``clean-files`` can *delete files and directories from the file system*, which can be used for such fine-tuning. However, it has a side-effect which results in a flush of cache and downloads which in turn makes consequent build runs take minutes instead of seconds, thus making it impractical.
I think, basic file operations like ``copy-files`` and ``clean-files`` should be under user control without side-effects, not to mention, being intuitive.
